title: Research Areas
text:
Solid Earth Dynamics


Understanding mantle plumes, mid-ocean ridges, deep mantle heterogeneities, and rheology through geodynamical modeling, informed by geophysical and geochemical observations.


Read more →







Surface Processes and Interior-surface Coupling


Investigating how Earth’s deep interior interacts with surface processes—including sea-level change, cryosphere-solid earth interactions and volatile cycling—with implications for planetary evolution and habitability.


Read more →







Experimental, Computational, and Machine Learning methods in Geophysics


Advancing and applying novel approaches—including laboratory experiments, hybrid adjoint methods, and machine learning—to analyze, simulate and invert complex geodynamic systems.


Read more →

title: Xiyuan Bao
text:
Xiyuan Bao


Daly Postdoctoral Fellow, Department of Earth and Planetary Sciences, Harvard University


Research: Mantle Dynamics · Surface Processes and Interior–Surface Coupling · Machine Learning in Earth Science


 Email   Google Scholar   ORCID   GitHub   LinkedIn 



I received my PhD in geophysics from UCLA and currently I am a Reginald A. Daly Postdoctoral Fellow at Harvard University. I explore how Earth’s deep interior flows, deforms, and drives surface change—from mantle plumes to sea-level rise, with simulations, experiments and machine learning. Learn more on the Research page.
